sen.j: 台湾総督府（たいわんそうとくふ、旧字体：臺灣總督府）は、清から大日本帝国へ割譲され、日本領となった台湾を統治するために設置された当時の日本の官庁名である。
sen.e: Taiwan Sotoku-fu (old form of a character: 臺灣總督府) is the name of the Japanese authorities then which was established for ruling Taiwan, ceded from Qing to Empire of Japan and became Japanese territory.

Taiwan Sotoku-fu (old form of a character: 臺灣總督府) is the name of the Japanese authorities then, which was established for ruling Taiwan, ceded from Qing to Empire of Japan and became Japanese territory.
sen.cmt: 厳密には過去形が適切と思われます。カッコ内の不要なスペースを削除しました。Whichの前にコンマを入れました。
sen.e: Taiwan Sotoku-fu (old form of a character: 臺灣總督府) is the name of the Japanese authorities then, which was established for ruling Taiwan, ceded from Qing to Empire of Japan and became Japanese territory.

sen.j: 台北市に設置された台湾総督府本庁舎は、現在も中華民国の中華民国総統府として使用されている。
sen.e: The headquarters of Taiwan Sotoku-fu founded in Taipei City is still used as the supreme ruler office of Republic of China.
The headquarters of Taiwan Sotoku-fu founded in Taipei City is still used as the supreme ruler office of Republic of China.
The headquarters of Taiwan Sotoku-fu founded in Taipei City is still used as the supreme ruler office of Republic of China.

sen.j: また昨今の国際情勢の影響により、近隣にはミサイルを多数配備し、憲兵が小銃を装備し護衛にあたっている。
sen.e: By the influence of international situation of these days, a lot of missiles are arrayed around there and the military policemen equipped with a rifle and acted as a bodyguard.
By the influence of international situation of these days, a lot of missiles are arrayed around there and the military policemen equipped with a rifle acts as a bodyguard.
sen.cmt: policemenの動詞が分かりづらいので（「are」の省略又はequipped/actedと考えることもできます）、equippedを修飾語とみなしactを動詞としました。
sen.e: By the influence of international situation of these days, a lot of missiles are arrayed around there and the military policemen equipped with a rifle acts as a bodyguard.

sen.j: 1895年の下関条約の締結から1945年の日本の敗戦まで台湾を支配・統治した。
sen.e: Japan ruled over Taiwan from the conclusion of the Treaty of Shimonoseki of 1895 to Japanese defeat of 1945 and governed it.
Japan ruled over and governed Taiwan from 1895 when the Treaty of Shimonoseki was concluded to 1945 when Japan was defeated.
sen.cmt: 「ruled over」と「governed」をandでつなぎ、年号とできごとを、年号→when→できごとでつなぎました。
sen.e: Japan ruled over and governed Taiwan from 1895 when the Treaty of Shimonoseki was concluded to 1945 when Japan was defeated.

sen.j: 台湾総督は台湾の行政・司法・立法から軍事までを一手に掌握しうる強大な権限を持ったため「土皇帝」と呼ばれた程である（後に軍事権が台湾軍 (日本軍)司令官に移譲されたことにより、文官の総督就任が可能になる）。
sen.e: Power was highly centralized with the governor-general of Taiwan wielding the public administration, administration of justice, legislation and military, therefore it was called 'Do Kotei', the local emperor (later, the military power was transferred to the Taiwanese army (Japanese army) so the civil officers could assume the governor-general.)

Power was highly centralized with the governor-general of Taiwan wielding the public administration, administration of justice, legislation and military, therefore it was called 'Do Kotei', the local emperor (later, the military power was transferred to the Taiwanese army [Japanese army] so the civil officers could assume the governor-general).
sen.cmt: カッコ内の不要なスペースを削除し、二重カッコを［］にしました。ここでは総督がgovernor-generalと訳されています。タイトルの総督府がSotoku-fuだったら、こちらもSotoku、またはタイトルをgovernment generalにするなど、統一する必要があると思われます。
sen.e: Power was highly centralized with the Taiwan governor wielding the public administration, administration of justice, legislation and military, therefore it was called 'Do Kotei', the local emperor (later, the military power was transferred to the Taiwanese army [Japanese army] so the civil officers could assume the governer).
sen.cmt: the governor-general of Taiwan→Taiwan governor 引用符修正（‘→'）しました。

sen.j: 但し台湾総督は内閣総理大臣、内務大臣 (日本)、拓務大臣の指揮監督を受けることになっており、天皇直属の朝鮮総督府より地位が低かった。
sen.e: But the Taiwan governor was commanded and managed by the prime minister, the prewar Home Minister (Japan) and the minister of Colonial Ministry, therefore their position was lower than Chosen Sotoku-fu under the direct control of the emperor.

But the Taiwan governor was commanded and managed by the prime minister, the prewar Home Minister (Japan) and the minister of Colonial Ministry, therefore Taiwan governor's position was lower than Chosen Sotoku-fu under the direct control of the emperor.
sen.cmt: カッコ内の不要なスペースを削除しました。Thereforeの後のtheirは、直前の3つのministerとも解釈されかねませんので、Taiwan governorにしました。
sen.e: But the Taiwan governor was commanded and managed by the prime minister, the prewar Home Minister (Japan) and the minister of Colonial Ministry, therefore Taiwan governor's position was lower than Chosen Sotoku-fu under the direct control of the emperor.

sen.j: 初代総督は樺山資紀で当初は陸海軍の将官が総督を務めた。
sen.e: The first governor-general was Sukenori KABAYAMA, at first the general of Army and Navy filled the role of the governor-general.
The first governor-general was Sukenori KABAYAMA, and the general of Army and Navy filled the role of the governor-general at first.
sen.cmt: コンマの前後の文章の関係が分かりませんでしたのでandでつなぎ、at firstを最後に移動しました。
sen.e: The first governor-general was Sukenori KABAYAMA, and the general of Army and Navy filled the role of the governor-general at first.

sen.j: 兒玉源太郎総督の下で1898年に民政長官に就任した後藤新平は、土地改革、ライフラインの整備、アヘン中毒患者の撲滅、学校教育の普及、製糖業などの産業の育成を行うことにより台湾の近代化を推進し、一方で植民地統治に対する反逆者には取り締まりをするという『飴と鞭』の政策を有効に用いることで植民地支配の体制を確立した。
sen.e: In 1898 Shimpei GOTO assumed the place of the Chief of Home Affairs under the direction of Gentaro KODAMA, the governor-general, and Goto established Japan's approach to ruling Taiwan adopting "the carrot and stick" policy effectively; promoted Taiwan to be a modern country by land reform, maintenance of lifeline, eradication of an opium addict, popularization of the school educational system, development of industries like making sugar and so on, on the other hand, did the regulation of the traitor against colonial rule.

In 1898 Shimpei GOTO assumed the place of the Chief of Home Affairs under the direction of Gentaro KODAMA, the governor-general, and GOTO established Japan's approach to rule Taiwan by adopting "the carrot and stick" policy effectively; promoted Taiwan to be a modern country by land reform, maintenance of lifeline, eradication of an opium addict, popularization of the school educational system, development of industries like sugar manufacture, on the other hand, controlled the traitor against colonial rule.
sen.cmt: to ruling→to rule、adopting→by adoptingにしました。GotoをGOTOにしました。Promotedが、前の文章の何から、どのように続くのかが不明です。(established、controlledと並列？）making sugar and so on→sugar manufactureにしました。did the regulation of→controlledにしました。
sen.e: In 1898, Shinpei GOTO assumed the post of Chief of Home Affairs under the direction of Gentaro KODAMA, the governor-general, and GOTO established Japan's approach to its rule of Taiwan through the effective use of a "carrot and stick" policy; that is, he promoted the modernization of Taiwan by carrying out land reform, providing utilities that were essential to people's livelihoods, eradicating opium addiction, making school educational more accessible to all, and developing industries such as sugar manufacturing, while at the same time cracking down on those who opposed colonial rule.
sen.cmt: Shimpei →Shinpei 引用符を全角にしました。一部書き換えました。

tit.cmt: government-generalを括弧内に入れました。

sen.j: 台湾人の職員も多く採用されたが、徹底した差別により高位高官への昇進の機会は閉ざされていた。
sen.e: Many Taiwanese staffs were employed, but there was no opportunity of the promotion to a high officerby thorough discrimination against them.
Although many Taiwanese staffs were employed, their opportunity of promotion to a high officer was thwarted by heavy discrimination.
sen.cmt: but→Althoughにして文頭に移動しました。後半の文章は「there was no opportunity」は「機会は閉ざされていた」と異なると思われましたので、thwart（hinderなども考えられます）を用いて言い換えました。
sen.e: Although many Taiwanese staffs were employed, their opportunity of promotion to a high officer was thwarted by heavy discrimination.

sen.j: 州知事・庁長、市尹（内地の市長に相当）は全て日本人であり、総督府に属する高等官1,444人（1943年時点）のうち、台湾人は30人以下にすぎず台湾人の警察人員は全て巡査以下だった。
sen.e: Prefectural governor, Director general and Shiin (it corresponds the mayor of inland) were all Japanese and only 30 or less Taiwanese in 1,444 of the senior officials belonged to the Sotoku-fu (at the time of 1943), other Taiwanese personnel were patrol officers or lower rank.

Prefectural governor, Director general and Shiin (which corresponds to the mayor of inland) were all Japanese, and out of 1,444 of senior officials belonged to the sotoku-fu (at the time of 1943) the Taiwanese were only less than 30, with other Taiwanese personnel being patrol officers or lower rank.
sen.cmt: カッコ内の不要なスペースを削除しました。カッコ内、it corresponds→which corresponds toにしました。And only 30で始まる中間の文章を「30人未満の台湾人が･･･」→「台湾人は30人未満」の構造にし、other以下の最後の文をwithの付帯状況の文にしました。
sen.e: Prefectural governor, Director general and Shiin (which corresponds to the mayor of inland) were all Japanese, and out of 1,444 of senior officials belonged to the sotoku-fu (at the time of 1943) the Taiwanese were only less than 30, with other Taiwanese personnel being patrol officers or lower rank.

sen.j: 公立旧制中学校の校長に任命された台湾人はなく、国民学校も分教場を入れて4人のみだった。
sen.e: There was not Taiwanese assigned as the principal of the junior high school under the old system of education, in the national elementary school (in an educational system operated in Japan between 1941 and 1947) and branch school, only 4 people were assumed the place of the principal.

No Taiwanese was assigned as the principal of the junior high school under the old system of education, and only 4 people were assumed the place of the principal in the national elementary school (in an educational system operated in Japan between 1941 and 1947) and branch school.
sen.cmt: There was no→NoTaiwaneseにしました。コンマのあとのinが、前半、後半のどちらに続くか分かりづらいので、最後に移動しました。
sen.e: No Taiwanese was assigned as the principal of the junior high school under the old system of education, and only 4 people were assumed the place of the principal in the national elementary school (in an educational system operated in Japan between 1941 and 1947) and branch school.
